title: Political Efficacy and Views of Government

content.description:
POLITICAL EFFICACY AND PARTY AFFILIATION

Source: Pew Research Center, 2015.
content.question: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the data in the graphs?

choices.label: Those with greater political efficacy are Republicans; as a result, they hold more conservative views on how the government needs to be reformed.
Those with greater political efficacy have a more positive view of government; as a result, they are more likely to vote in elections.
Those who are angry with government are more likely to be Republicans and vote in elections.
Those who know more about government and politics tend to be more skeptical of both.

content.answer: Those with greater political efficacy have a more positive view of government; as a result, they are more likely to vote in elections.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
